sn22.83:2.1: Puṇṇa son of Mantāṇī was most famous for his conversation with Sāriputta in MN 24, on the strength of which he was said to be the best Dhamma speaker (AN 1.196). His verse is at Thag 1.4:1.7. For his mother’s name, see note on MN 86:12.12.
sn22.83:2.3: “Because of grasping” (upādāya) rather than the commentary’s “derived from”, which takes an object in genitive.
sn22.83:4.3: Note the equality in terms of address: a newly ordained monk and their teacher refer to each other as “reverend” (āvuso; see DN 16:6.2.1).
